results.adx_keywords: Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Colleges and Universities;Kohberger, Bryan C;Chapin, Ethan (d 2022);Goncalves, Kaylee (d 2022);Kernodle, Xana (d 2022);Mogen, Madison (d 2022);University of Idaho;Washington State University;Idaho;Moscow (Idaho)
results.byline: By Nicholas Bogel-Burroughs and Mike Baker
results.title: Idaho Killings Suspect Got New License Plate 5 Days After Murders
results.abstract: Records show that the suspect’s Hyundai Elantra got a new registration in Washington State shortly after four students at the University of Idaho were murdered.

media.caption: Dashboard camera footage released by the Indiana State Police showed a trooper stopping Bryan Kohberger and his father on Dec. 15 for following a vehicle too closely.

results.adx_keywords: Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Enoch City (Utah)
results.byline: By Michael Levenson, Livia Albeck-Ripka and McKenna Oxenden
results.title: Utah Man Kills Wife, Five Children and Mother-in-Law, Police Say
results.abstract: Michael Haight, 42, fatally shot seven family members and then killed himself in the family’s house in Enoch City about two weeks after his wife filed for divorce, officials said.

media.caption: A law enforcement official stands near the front door of the Enoch, Utah, home where eight people had been fatally shot.
media.copyright: Ben B. Braun/The Deseret News, via Associated Press

results.adx_keywords: Football;Emergency Medical Treatment;Stadiums and Arenas;Hamlin, Damar (1998- );Buffalo Bills;National Football League
results.byline: By Ken Belson, Alan Blinder and Robin Stein
results.title: ‘We’re Going to Need Everybody’: Recordings Captured Response to N.F.L. Crisis
results.abstract: When Damar Hamlin’s heart stopped during a game on Monday night, medical personnel can be heard responding to the kind of emergency the league hoped it would never face.

media.caption: For about a half-hour at Paycor Stadium in Cincinnati, a small army of doctors, athletic trainers and emergency workers rushed to save Damar Hamlin.

results.adx_keywords: Royal Families;Documentary Films and Programs;Books and Literature;Assaults;Buckingham Palace;Guardian (British Newspaper);Penguin Random House;Great Britain
results.title: Prince Harry Writes of Physical Attack by His Brother, According to Report
results.abstract: “He knocked me to the floor,” Harry recounts of the alleged assault by Prince William, according to The Guardian, which said it had obtained a copy of Harry’s coming book.

media.caption: The princes and their wives in Windsor, England, in September. Prince Harry, second from left, said that he had been attacked by his brother, William, right, during a furious argument over Harry’s marriage to Meghan Markle, left.
media.copyright: Mary Turner for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Murray, Patty;Senate
results.title: Senator Patty Murray is second in line to the presidency, for now.
results.abstract: The Washington State Democrat was elected president pro tempore of the Senate, which is normally third in line. But there is no speaker of the House yet.

media.caption: Senator Patty Murray, center, has served in the chamber for 30 years.
media.copyright: Anna Rose Layden for The New York Times

results.title: Biden Administration Defends Student Loan Cancellation at Supreme Court
results.abstract: In a brief filed with the justices, the president’s lawyers argued that his administration had acted within its authority in moving to forgive hundreds of billions in student debt.

media.caption: President Biden’s student debt cancellation plan is on hold while the Supreme Court considers it.
media.copyright: Al Drago for The New York Times

results.title: How Will the Suspended Bills-Bengals Game Be Resolved?
results.abstract: The N.F.L. has a number of options, none of them perfect, for how to handle competition for the last week of the regular season and the playoffs.

media.caption: Paycor Stadium in Cincinnati was the site of the suspended Bills-Bengals game.

results.title: Biden Announces Major Crackdown on Illegal Border Crossings

results.title: Amazon Expands Corporate Layoffs to 18,000 Jobs
results.abstract: The layoffs will focus on human resources and its retail division, Amazon’s chief executive said in an email to employees.

media.caption: Andy Jassy, Amazon’s chief executive, said in an email to employees that the next wave of layoffs would begin Jan. 18.

results.title: Judge Rules for Justice Dept. in Dispute With Trump Over Documents Search
results.abstract: The court said the former president had to provide the government the names of private investigators he hired to search his properties last year for any classified material still in his possession.

results.title: A Knife Sheath, Phone Pings and Trash: The Hunt for a Killer in Idaho

media.caption: “In my line of work obviously there’s a public part of publication and that can sometimes make you self-conscious,” Matt Haig said.

results.title: U.S. Moves to Bar Noncompete Agreements in Labor Contracts
results.abstract: A sweeping proposal by the Federal Trade Commission would block companies from limiting their employees’ ability to work for a rival.
